title: Skins
content:
**Contents*** [Skins in XWiki](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Skins#HSkinsinXWiki)
* [Screenshots](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Skins#HScreenshots)
* [Changing the Skin](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Skins#HChangingtheSkin)
* [More about XWiki Skins](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Skins#HMoreaboutXWikiSkins)
* [Skins Extensions](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Skins#HSkinsExtensions)
A skin is a visual organization of content for wiki pages. It's different from [Color Themes](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Flamingo%20Theme%20Application) which are set of colors for the various elements of a skin. Note that a given skin must support Color Themes to use them.

# Skins in XWiki

The latest version of XWiki bundles the following skins by default:

You can find the full list of existing skins on the [Extensions wiki](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/).

# Screenshots

Some Skins developed by the XWiki dev team (see [more](http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionCode/AllExtensions/#|t=extensions&p=1&l=30&s=doc.creationDate&d=desc&category=skin)):

[![flamingo.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Flamingo%20Skin/flamingo.png?width=100&height=100&rev=1.12)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Flamingo%20Skin)  [![Colibri.png](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Skins/Colibri.png?width=100&height=100&rev=1.8)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Colibri%20Skin) [![Toucan.png](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Skins/Toucan.png?width=100&height=100&rev=1.1)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Toucan%20Skin)

# Changing the Skin

A skin can be changed at different levels:

* For the whole wiki
* For a given space
* For a given user

In order to change the skin at wiki and space level, the user has to be an administrator for the current XWiki instance. To find more about how to change a skin, check the [Changing the Skin](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Skins#HChangingtheSkin) section in the Admin Guide.

# More about XWiki Skins

* Learn how to [manage XWiki skins](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Skins)
* Learn how to [develop new skins](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/DevGuide/Tutorials/Skins/)

# Skins Extensions

**Skins extensions** (or, abbreviated **SX**) are an alternative for developers who want to modify the layout and behavior of certain or all documents in their wiki without the need of changing its skin templates and/or stylesheets. The Skin extensions mechanism, available in all versions of XWiki superior to 1.5, provide the developers with the possibility of pulling extra stylesheets and Javascript files that are not bundled with the skin. You can find out more about Skin Extensions by reading the [Skin Extensions Tutorial](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/DevGuide/Tutorials/SkinExtensionsTutorial/) in the Developer Guide.
